title.narrative: By 2026, gaps in key socio-economic indicators are reduced, reflecting greater gender equality and progress in the empowerment of youth, women and girls, and other vulnerable groups, including in humanitarian contexts. (Outcome 2.2 /UNSDCF)

title.narrative: SN_DRF
Capacity of the NSS strengthened to produce the gender-related Tier I/II/III indicators to address national data gaps
% of SDG gender-related Tier I/II indicators that can be produced by reprocessing existing data (surveys, administrative and/or alternative sources available before 2018
% of SDG gender-related Tier I/II indicators that can be produced by reprocessing existing data (surveys, administrative and/or alternative sources available before 2018
Conducted and/or analyzed an existing (recent, less than 5 years), a) Time use survey, and/or b) violence against women prevalence survey
Conducted and/or analyzed an existing (recent, less than 5 years), a) Time use survey, and/or b) violence against women prevalence survey
National data on gender is increasingly available at national and local level
Central web-based database for storing and sharing gender-related SDGs indicators developed and available online
Central web-based database for storing and sharing gender-related SDGs indicators developed and available online
Number of annually produced/updated Gender Profile reports
Number of knowledge products (policy research, policy briefs, leaflets on gender indicators, etc) published in support of gender assessments of SDG implementation
Gaps in the integration of gender statistics in national policy and monitoring and Evaluation Frameworks are identified and recommendations for addressing them are formulated
Existence of a validated assessment report highlighting gaps for the integration of gender statistics in national policy and M&E Frameworks
Existence or not of a formal institutional arrangements for the coordination of the compilation of gender statistics at national level (derived from FPI indicator)
Existence or not of a formal institutional arrangements for the coordination of the compilation of gender statistics at national level (derived from FPI indicator)
Number of Communication and advocacy tools on gender statistics and SDGs produced and disseminated
(UN Women internal): Funding gap for WC Cameroon as a % of total project cost.
Number of Communication and advocacy tools on gender statistics and SDGs produced and disseminated
(UN Women internal): Funding gap for WC Cameroon as a % of total project cost.

Gaps in the integration of a gender perspective in the National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS-2015-2020) and the 2018 Monitoring and Evaluation Framework for SDGs are identified and recommendations for addressing them are formulated
Existence of a draft advocacy note on the integration of gender statistics into the NSDS
Minimum set of gender indicators (including gender-related SDG indicators) developed for national monitoring and submitted to the NCS for adoption
Minimum set of gender indicators (including gender-related SDG indicators) developed for national monitoring and submitted to the NCS for adoption
Existence of a draft advocacy note on the integration of gender statistics into the NSDS
Disparities between men and women are reduced in all areas of national life (political, economic, social, cultural, sports, etc.), and there is statistical data to reflect this (LPP, GRB).
The National Gender Policy is updated and monitored
Number of Ministries and States institutions that implement GRB principles with the support of UN Women

Women and young girls and boys are protected from all forms of violence and discrimination against them in all areas of public life including in development and humanitairian settings (CERF, WPS, CERF, COVID-19 Response etc)).
Proportion of Women in humanitarian situation that received assistance with the support of UN Women
Proportion of women/girls who are victims of domestic violence
HIV /AIDS and MHM are better mainstreamed in national and locals plans ,programmes and budgets
Number of schools of with improved gender sensitive WASH facilities and menstrual hygiene management services with UNWOMEN support
Number of initiatives support by UNWOMEN conducted by local authorities and community leaders to promote HIV prevention and Menstrual hygiene management best pratices to end stigmatization
Number of national HIV strategies and plans supported by UNW that include gender responsive actions and budgets
Number of national strategies and plans on HIV and MHM supported by UNW that include gender responsive actions and budgets
Improved and efficient coordination mechanism of GEWE across UN System, government and CSO both in development and humanitarian settings (Coordination)
Existence of a functional coordination mechanism on gender equality and empowerment of women and gils within CSO, Government and the UN System
Proportion of UN Joint-Programmes with a focus on gender equality in which UN-Women participates as a Participating United Nations Organization
Capacity of data producers strengthened on gender statistics
Number of knowledge products (policy research, policy briefs, leaflets on gender indicators, etc) published in support of gender assessments of SDG implementation
Number of knowledge products (policy research, policy briefs, leaflets on gender indicators, etc) published in support of gender assessments of SDG implementation
Number of training schools of statistics that have integrated a gender module into their training curriculum with the support UN Women
Number of training schools of statistics that have agreed with the introduction of a gender module into their training curriculum with the support UN Women
Number of trainings for data producers on the collection of data and compilation of gender statistics supported by UN Women
Number of trainings for data producers on the collection of data and compilation of gender statistics supported by UN Women
Capacity of civil society, government and other actors to use and analyze gender statistics is strengthened
Number of trainings for data users on the collection of data and compilation of gender statistics supported by UN Women
Number of trainings for data users on the collection of data and compilation of gender statistics supported by UN Women
User-producer dialogues institutionalized to increase accessibility, quality and demand for gender statistics
Number of meetings to facilitate collaboration between users and producers organized annually
Number of meetings to facilitate collaboration between users and producers organized annually
Total number of participants in user-producer dialogues (with academia, CSO, government, development actors in attendance
Total number of participants in user-producer dialogues (with academia, CSO, government, development actors in attendance

The potentials of young girls and women are enhanced to enable them to participate in development efforts in all sectors and enjoy the benefits of growth on an equal basis with men (Genre et Route, PDCVA, IFAD etc.)
Number of women and girls trained in Income Generating Activities
Gender statistics coordination mechanisms are set up and operational
Existence of functional coordination bodies for gender statistics across the NSS
Functionning of coordination bodies for gender statistics across the NSS
